page.title: 09LOCAL HISTORY OF DUNDONALD
page.content: The site at Dundonald has been occupied since the time of the Stone Age. The presence of a river and the fact that Dundonald occupies a valley made it suitable for habitation. The early people left behind monuments such as standing stones and dolmens. The most famous dolmen in the area is known as Kempe Stones. The Celts built a rath or dun in the area and it is from this the name of the village originated. It was called Dun - Domniall: the fort of Donald. Nothing, however, is known about the person called Donald.
